issue.title: Filter Pull requests by reviewer
issue.body: In Team Explorer > Pull Requests, there seems to be no way of seeing only the pull requests where I am either the reviewer or the author. This would be great when you work in a larger team with multiple reviewers.

issue.title: Bitbucket clone location is different from VS & GitHub clone location
issue.body:
The default cloning location for Visual Studio as a whole and GitHub is at `%userprofile%\source\repos\`. The Bitbucket VS extension's default cloning location is at `%userprofile%\Documents\source\repos\`.

Can this be changed to match Visual Studio's default cloning location? I don't want to have to change the cloning path each time I want to clone something from Bitbucket.

issue.title: Visual Studio 2019 Start Up Prompt has no option for BitBucket.
issue.body:
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10372299/60071220-fcfd5600-9736-11e9-92e9-5aae4d75cdb3.JPG)
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10372299/60071221-fcfd5600-9736-11e9-8016-a7af73d5ce7c.JPG)

As one can observe in the attached images, I do not have an option to directly clone from Bitbucket using my log in credentials. I need to type the Git URL manually, while for Azure there is an option.

```
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2019
Version 16.1.3
VisualStudio.16.Release/16.1.3+29009.5
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03190

```

issue.title: Creating Pull Request in VS2019 fails
issue.body:
Creating a Pull Request in latest Visual Studio 2019 Enterprise (extension version 1.41.1) fails with error message:

```Errors encountered while adding some reviewers to this pull request```

It did allow me to correctly select and add the reviewers.

issue.title: BitBucket Login Window is empty
issue.body:
When I click on Login, the modal login window appears with a dark blue background but nothing in it. When I move the mouse over the window, the cursor sometimes changes from pointer to caret and a tooltip appears, so the textboxes for server url, user name, etc. are there but seem to be invisible!

Happens with the latest version 1.40.3 in both VS2017 and VS2019.

issue.title: Can't build Test projects from source
issue.body:
Two of the Test projects (Bitbucket.REST.API.Tests + GitClientVS.Infrastructure.Tests) depend on very old `Microsoft.Reactive` / `System.Reactive` versions. In fact so old that these dependencies aren't even present in `packages.config`, they only exist in the `.csproj` files (so the referenced .dlls have to exist magically).

The referenced version is 2.3.0.0:

    <Reference Include="Microsoft.Reactive.Testing, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\..\packages\Rx-Testing.2.3.0-beta2\lib\net46\Microsoft.Reactive.Testing.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>
    <Reference Include="System.Reactive.Core, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\..\packages\Rx-Core.2.3.0-beta2\lib\net46\System.Reactive.Core.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>
    <Reference Include="System.Reactive.Interfaces, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\..\packages\Rx-Interfaces.2.3.0-beta2\lib\net46\System.Reactive.Interfaces.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>
    <Reference Include="System.Reactive.Linq, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\..\packages\Rx-Linq.2.3.0-beta2\lib\net46\System.Reactive.Linq.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>
    <Reference Include="System.Reactive.PlatformServices, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\..\packages\Rx-PlatformServices.2.3.0-beta2\lib\net46\System.Reactive.PlatformServices.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>
    <Reference Include="System.Reactive.Windows.Threading, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>..\..\..\..\packages\Rx-XAML.2.3.0-beta2\lib\net46\System.Reactive.Windows.Threading.dll</HintPath>
    </Reference>

The HintPath is nowhere to be found after doing `git clone` + `package restore`. Also the oldest version on NuGet of these packages is v3.0.0, so Install+Restore is only possible to a higher version (for which I can't oversee the consequences).

Quickest 'fix' was either to delete these Test projects from the Solution, or to disable them both in the `Debug` + `Release` Build configs, and then I could successfully build.
